class  Sample
 Representation of a single sound sample. More...

Detailed Description

A sound sample set allowing to play multiple sound samples.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Sound (  int  maxChannels = 32  ) 
 

Creates a new sound set.

Parameters:
maxChannels the maximum of sound samples that can be played at the same time.
Precondition:
maxChannels must be less than or equal to 1024.

~Sound (   ) 
 

Destroys this object.

The close() method must have been called before.

Member Function Documentation

Sound::Sample * add (  const char *  fileName  ) 
 

Loads a sound sample.

Parameters:
fileName a valid sound sample file name (allowed formats : wav, mp3, ogg).

void close (   ) 
 

Closes the sound device.

Must be called before destroying this object.

bool contains (  int  i  )  const
 

Tells if specified index is a valid sample index.

Returns:
true iff the specified index is a valid index.

bool init (   ) 
 

Initalizes the sound device.

Must be called before any other of the following methods.

Returns:
true on success, false if some error occured.

bool pause (   )  const
 

Pauses all currently playing sound samples.

Returns:
true on success, false if some error occured.

bool remove (  int  i  ) 
 

Removes a sample from this sample set.

Parameters:
i the index of the sample to remove.

bool resume (   )  const
 

Resumes all currently paused sound samples.

Returns:
true on success, false if some error occured.

Sound::Sample * sample (  int  i  )  const
 

Retrieves a sample from its index.

Parameters:
i the index of the sample to obtain.
Returns:
the corresponding sample or NULL if it does not exist (i.e. if contains(i) returns false).

bool stop (   )  const
 

Stops all currently playing sound samples.

Returns:
true on success, false if some error occured.
